text: Guarinisuchus is an extinct genus of crocodyliform from the Late Cretaceous and Early Paleocene periods, 66-62 million years ago of the Mar√≠a Farinha Formation, Brazil.Guarinisuchus at Fossilworks.org It was a dominant predator in its environment, and reached a length of 3 m (10 ft). Guarinisuchus appears to be closely related to marine crocodylomorphs found in Africa, which supports the hypothesis that the group originated in Africa and migrated to South America before spreading into the waters off the North American coast.The new Brazilian crocodile ==References== Category:Archosaurs
title: Guarinisuchus
